UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING SERVICES
April h> 1958
Dr# Sam Becker, Director
Television Center
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
Your January 28th letter did not structure my thinking,” as you put it#
In fact, my thinking has been very unstructured since we have started to
lay plans for ETV; one day we’re to go ahead, the next day the Gov# says
we can’t, and the following day he claims he really didn't mean it#—Take
this sort of thing once a day for twelve months and you can see why a
person's thinking becomes very unstructured#—Let this then be a formal
appeal that if you hear of a decent teaching job or a radio management one,
I’m really in the market for a move#
Let’s get to the interesting problem: NAEB Research. These are ideas I have
jotted down but not having too much connection at times.
1) I believe we need to redefine the purpose of these grants; that is,
spell out for ourselves just what type of project we will okay#
The first time we approved grants, few of us were really happy
about the selections, but we went ahead with it to get things
started#—Now on the recent requests it was interesting to note
our voting was so close, however, even though I may be splitting
hairs, some of the money went for approval of items we hadn't
approved during that first year.
So, in other words, can we this year define just what we want on
these# Do we want to approve typing expenses, payment to clerks, etc#
2) If funds are available for a Director of Research, won't we need
to spell out the relationship between his position and that of
the Research Committee, as well as Headquarters?
What about an operating budget for him? If he is to travel to
Washington, shouldn't funds be available for this as well as
funds for the Chairman?
3) Speaking of money, can we get funds for a three-day meet at
Columbus, for the Committee?
U) Perhaps this is the time we also need to think about results#
I'm confused as to whom will be benefited# Is this work to be
of direct help to managers, or producers, or professors? —Maybe
all of them somewhere along the line, of course# But can we start
